title: How to Make Eggplant Pasta Sauce

steps.headline: Cut the eggplant into 1/2-inch thick slices and sprinkle with salt.
steps.description: Re-stack the slices and let sit for 20 minutes. Blot thoroughly with paper towels to remove excess liquid. Cut into 1/2-inch cubes.

steps.headline: Heat oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
steps.description: When hot, add garlic and sauté approximately 1 minute, or until garlic is fragrant.

steps.headline: Add eggplant and salt and pepper to saucepan and cook, stirring occasionally, until eggplant starts to turn translucent.
Pour in chicken broth and thyme.
steps.description: Cover the pan. Stir occasionally until the eggplant is soft and the sauce has a saucy texture. Add more water if it has reduced too much.

steps.headline: Remove from heat.
steps.description: Mash sauce with a fork to desired consistency. Add basil leaves and tomatoes and serve on pasta. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

text: Cut the eggplant into 1/2-inch thick slices and sprinkle with salt. Re-stack the slices and let sit for 20 minutes. Blot thoroughly with paper towels to remove excess liquid. Cut into 1/2-inch cubes. Heat oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. When hot, add garlic and sauté approximately 1 minute, or until garlic is fragrant. Add eggplant and salt and pepper to saucepan and cook, stirring occasionally, until eggplant starts to turn translucent.  Pour in chicken broth and thyme. Cover the pan. Stir occasionally until the eggplant is soft and the sauce has a saucy texture. Add more water if it has reduced too much. Remove from heat. Mash sauce with a fork to desired consistency. Add basil leaves and tomatoes and serve on pasta. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Enjoy!
